headline: Is Adobe (ADBE) Turning Its AI Ambitions Into a Slower-Growth Story?
summary: In early January 2026, Jefferies downgraded Adobe to Hold, citing slower topline trends since fiscal 2023 and limited near-term revenue impact from its artificial intelligence offerings. This move has sharpened attention on whether Adobe’s growing AI usage and integrations can translate into material, measurable revenue contributions amid rising competition. Next, we’ll examine how Jefferies’ concerns about Adobe’s AI monetization and growth trajectory may reshape the company’s existing...

headline: Jefferies’ top software stocks to own led by Microsoft, Meta
summary: Investing.com -- Jefferies is urging investors to remain selective in software in 2026, arguing that growth “decelerates and lags versus other sectors like semis,” and recommending an underweight position until artificial intelligence monetisation becomes more visible.

headline: Jefferies downgrades Adobe, upgrades IBM as AI reshapes 2026 software outlook
summary: Investing.com -- Jefferies has shifted its software recommendations for 2026, downgrading Adobe to Hold while upgrading IBM to Buy, as analysts warn that investors may “need to stay patient” for meaningful AI-driven revenue acceleration.

headline: Returns expected to spike in the new year
summary: Compared to earlier in the holiday season, returns will rise by up to 15% in the first two weeks of this month, according to Adobe Analytics.

headline: FloQast CFO on why the demand for accountants is ‘skyrocketing’
